Article Title: Comcast reports data breach affecting 230,000 customers in ransomware attack
Article Text:
How the data breach happened

What is Comcast doing for impacted users

US telecom giant, Comcast has confirmed that a data breach involving some of its customers' information occurred in February 2024. The company revealed the incident following a recent court filing in Maine.According to the filing, the data breach originated from a ransomware attack targeting Financial Business and Consumer Solutions (FBCS), a debt collection agency previously used by Comcast.Hackers gained unauthorised access to FBCS 's computer network between February 14th and 26th, 2024. During this time, they reportedly downloaded sensitive data and encrypted some of the agency's systems.The compromised data reportedly includes personal information belonging to over 237,000 Comcast customers. This information potentially includes names, addresses, Social Security numbers, dates of birth, Comcast account numbers, and ID numbers used internally by FBCS.While Comcast claims they stopped using FBCS for debt collection in 2020, it appears the breach affects customers who were subscribers around 2021. Initial reports from FBCS allegedly indicated no customer data was compromised, leading to a delay in Comcast notifying affected individuals. It wasn't until July 2024 that the debt collection agency disclosed the data breach to Comcast.Comcast is currently notifying impacted customers and advising them to take steps to protect themselves from potential identity theft. To help mitigate the potential risks associated with the data breach, Comcast is providing affected customers with complimentary identity theft protection services for a period of at least 12 months. This includes membership in CyEx Identity Defense Complete, which offers comprehensive credit monitoring services. Along with this, the company has also asked the users to remain vigilant of frauds and check their account statements.
Article Summary: US telecom giant, Comcast has confirmed that a data breach involving some of its customers' information occurred in February 2024. The company revealed the incident following a recent court filing in Maine. The data breach originated from a ransomware attack targeting Financial Business and Consumer Solutions (FBCS), a debt collection agency previously used by Comcast.

Article Title: Grammarly services restored after outage: Here’s what happened
Article Text:
Grammarly acknowledged the outage

Grammarly is now back up after facing a disruption on October 7 that left many scrambling for alternatives. The AI writing tool faced an outage yesterday with users on both mobile and desktop impacted by it. According to a status page, the services are now restored with “All systems operational”.The outage began at around 11:58 PDT (12:28 am IST) on October 7.During the outage, users were seeing error messages like “Text checking is temporarily unavailable," "Can't connect to Grammary”. It was resolved at 14:24 PDT.Downdetector- the website performance tracker showed 264 error reports. According to it, Gramarly users on website, mobile and Chrome extensions were impacted.Noting the incident, the company said “We’re experiencing some service interruptions at the moment. Some users may have trouble logging in or creating accounts. Other users may not be able to see suggestions or corrections from Grammarly. You may also see various error messages when trying to use Grammarly ("Text checking is temporarily unavailable," "Can't connect to Grammary"). We’re investigating the problem and will provide an update as soon as possible."At 12:14 PDT, the comoany said that the issue has been resolved. "This incident has been resolved," reads a status page.
Article Summary: Grammarly faced an outage yesterday with users on both mobile and desktop impacted. According to a status page, the services are now restored with “All systems operational” The outage began at around 11:58 PDT (12:28 am IST) on October 7. It was resolved at 14:24 PDT.

Article Title: Google DeepMind exec shares what the company uses AI for 'big time'
Article Text: Google DeepMind is leveraging its own AI technology to streamline operations, particularly in its legal department, according to a top executive. Terra Terwilliger , director of strategic initiatives at Google DeepMind, revealed that the company's Gemini AI model now handles 40% to 50% of information requests sent to its legal team.Speaking at Fortune's COO Summit in Middleburg, Va., Terwilliger highlighted the significant time savings achieved through this implementation."It saves a remarkable amount of time," she noted, describing how AI is used for "finding information that you know you have somewhere, but you can't put your hand on it right then."This use of AI for information retrieval and basic tasks allows high-skilled employees to focus on more valuable work, Terwilliger explained. She emphasised the importance of training employees to use AI effectively, urging organisations to "make sure we're valuing the time that people are putting in to learn how to use these systems and rewarding them for doing so."Google DeepMind isn't alone in harnessing AI for routine tasks. At the same event, Sebastian Guth , chief operating officer of Bayer's global pharmaceuticals division, shared that his company uses AI to complete 70% to 80% of regulatory filings required for drug development.Both executives stressed that AI implementation is about improving organizational efficiency rather than replacing human workers. Guth cautioned against "using technology for technology's sake," emphasizing that AI should be a means to an end, such as developing drugs faster.
Article Summary: Google DeepMind is using AI to streamline operations, particularly in its legal department. The company's Gemini AI model now handles 40% to 50% of information requests sent to its legal team. Bayer uses AI to complete 70% to 80% of regulatory filings required for drug development.

Article Title: Epic ‘win’: 5 changes that Google has to bring and 5 things it can’t do after judge tells it to open Android to rival app stores
Article Text: A U.S. judge has mandated Google to open Android to rival third-party app stores and allow them to manage app transactions independently. The ruling results from Epic Games' 2020 lawsuit, aiming to counter Google's monopolistic control over app distribution and in-app payments on Android devices. Google is told to allow alternative app stores to operate on Android devices starting November 1, 2024 for three years.
Article Summary: Ruling results from Epic Games' 2020 lawsuit, aiming to counter Google's monopolistic control over app distribution and in-app payments. Google is told to allow alternative app stores to operate on Android devices starting November 1, 2024 for three years.

Article Title: Bharti Airtel may buy another 'loss-making' Tata Group company, after 7 years
Article Text: Bharti Airtel is in advanced talks with Tata Group to acquire Tata Play, aiming to consolidate its digital TV presence and enhance bundled offerings. This acquisition follows Bharti's 2017 purchase of Tata's consumer mobility business and addresses the growing competition and decline in DTH services due to OTT platforms.
Article Summary: Bharti Airtel is in advanced talks with Tata Group to acquire Tata Play. This acquisition follows Bharti's 2017 purchase of Tata's consumer mobility business. It addresses the growing competition and decline in DTH services due to OTT platforms.

Article Title: How price wars on online shopping websites may be hurting China and its economy
Article Text:
A platform built on deep discounts

A Global Trend with a Chinese Twist

The New York Times reports that Lin Yunyun, a 28-year-old seller on China's fast-growing e-commerce platform Pinduoduo, has experienced the relentless pressure to lower prices firsthand. Unlike what she expected, Pinduoduo constantly sends "reminders" whenever other sellers undercut her on diaper prices. Even after reducing her prices, the platform pushes for further cuts to maintain her product's visibility.Pinduoduo exemplifies China's current struggle with deflation.Consumers, rattled by a sluggish economy and a seemingly endless real estate crisis, are reportedly tightening their belts. This spending slowdown has triggered falling prices and shrinking profits, creating a vicious cycle. While the government scrambles for solutions, Pinduoduo thrives on this environment.Pinduoduo has become the go-to destination for value-conscious shoppers in China, embracing a trend called "downgraded spending." It's no surprise then, that with over 60% of Chinese consumers shopping online, Pinduoduo's aggressive pricing strategy, mirrored by competitors, has significantly contributed to the deflationary spiral.The NYT report captures the dilemma of Chinese journalist, Zhang Zhuo, who wrote in her reportedly censored WeChat post, "The Better Pinduoduo Is, the Worse the Times Are." She argued that Pinduoduo conditions consumers to prioritize the cheapest option over brand loyalty."Merchants have two choices: lower prices or lose sales," Zhang wrote.While some shoppers, like office worker Gao Ning, appreciate the convenience and value Pinduoduo offers, it comes at a cost. The platform's relentless price wars may be a convenient way to buy groceries and household goods, but they also reflect a deeper economic anxiety in China.
Article Summary: Pinduoduo has become the go-to destination for value-conscious shoppers in China, embracing a trend called "downgraded spending" The platform's aggressive pricing strategy, mirrored by competitors, has significantly contributed to the deflationary spiral.

Article Title: Google Chrome on Android may add support for browser extensions, but there's a catch
Article Text: Google is planning to bring browser extensions to Chrome on Android, but primarily for Chromebook users, through a new 'Desktop Android' version.
Article Summary: Google is planning to bring browser extensions to Chrome on Android, but primarily for Chromebook users. Google is planning a new 'Desktop Android' version of Chrome for Chrome users. The extension will be available for Chrome and Chrome OS devices, but not Chrome OS phones and tablets.

Article Title: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu calls for tighter regulation of big tech companies in India: ‘We need a level playing field for all’
Article Text: Sridhar Vembu , CEO of Zoho , has reiterated his call for stricter government intervention to prevent monopolisation by big tech companies and promote fair competition in the digital space. In an interview to PTI, Vembu emphasised the need for greater interoperability and urged the government to push for open standards.He drew parallels between email, which operates on open standards, and proprietary messaging services, highlighting the need for similar openness in digital communication."Messaging platforms should not operate in silos. We need standards that prevent monopolies and ensure a level playing field for all," Vembu stated.The Zoho founder praised India's Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) initiatives as a "shining success story" and a model for other nations to follow. He specifically mentioned the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) and the health stack as examples of India's leadership in digital infrastructure development.Earlier, Vembu had voiced support for Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal's criticism of LinkedIn for allegedly deleting posts and "bullying Indians." At that time, Vembu urged resistance against what he termed "woke imperialism," describing it as "a fanatical religious doctrine that masquerades as a socio-political movement."Vembu had also criticised Google for removing several Indian developers' apps from its Play Store. In a post on X (formerly Twitter), he stated, "What's happening with popular apps in India, such as Bharat Matrimony, Naukri, and others being delisted from the Google Play Store , is a classic case of monopoly abuse." He called for regulatory and judicial intervention to level the playing field, given Android's dominant position in India.In previous statements, Vembu had called for active government intervention in facilitating competition among tech companies in India. He suggested that authorities should prevent monopolistic practices, even if they involve his own company. "If Zoho wants to monopolise or acquire all the competition, the government maybe should not allow us," he had said, acknowledging the growing concern over wealth concentration among technology companies worldwide.
Article Summary: Sridhar Vembu, CEO of Zoho, has reiterated his call for stricter government intervention to prevent monopolisation by big tech companies. In an interview to PTI, he emphasised the need for greater interoperability and urged the government to push for open standards. He also praised India's Digital Public Infrastructure initiatives as a "shining success story"

Article Title: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg does another 'Shah Jahan' for his wife
Article Text:
Take a look at Mark Zuckerberg’s Instagram post

Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg showed off two new Porsches for himself and his wife, Priscilla Chan . These included the brand-new Porsche 911 GT3 with a touring package, and the fully-customized Porsche Cayenne Turbo GT ‘Minivan’ for Priscillia. Zuckerberg revealed that his unique Porsche minivan was a collaboration between the luxury automaker and West Coast Customs , a renowned Southern California auto shop famous for its custom work on classic and high-end vehicles.Sharing photos and videos on Instagram, he wrote: “New side quest. Priscilla wanted a minivan, so I've been designing something I'm pretty sure should exist: a Porsche Cayenne Turbo GT Minivan. Threw in a manual GT3 Touring to make it his and hers. Thanks @porsche and @westcoastcustoms for helping to make this happen.”Earlier this year in August, Zuckerberg unveiled a colossal sculpture of his wife in the backyard of their expansive California estate. “Bringing back the Roman tradition of making sculptures of your wife,” he then wrote in an Instagram post. Click here to read more Zuckerberg had the shop customize a manual Porsche 911 GT3 Touring in the same slate gray as Priscillia’s Cayenne Turbo GT Minivan, making a his and hers driving duo. The customised minivan appears to be featuring electric sliding doors and an extended frame.Replying to the post, Priscillia wrote “They put in a boost mode. For when I’m late for drop off???”.Mark Zuckerberg, despite his vast wealth, is known for driving relatively modest vehicles. He has been seen behind the wheel of a black Acura TSX, a Volkswagen Golf GTI hatchback, and a Honda Fit, which as per Business Insider were around $30,000 or less at the time. Pagani Huayra, an Italian sports car costing more than $1 million is his most flashy car till date.
Article Summary: Mark Zuckerberg showed off two new Porsches for himself and his wife, Priscilla Chan. These included the brand-new Porsche 911 GT3 with a touring package, and the fully-customized Porsche Cayenne Turbo GT ‘Minivan’ Zuckerberg revealed that his unique Porsche minivan was a collaboration between the luxury automaker and West Coast Customs.

Article Title: Microsoft stock stumbles; why and how AI may be to blame
Article Text: Microsoft's stock has lagged behind the tech market recently, partly due to AI fatigue and increased competition. The stock has grown only 1.3% in six months, with valuation concerns persisting.
Article Summary: The stock has grown only 1.3% in six months, with valuation concerns persisting. Microsoft's stock has lagged behind the tech market recently, partly due to AI fatigue and increased competition. The company is expected to announce a new product line in the coming weeks.

Article Title: Why Apple may be moving away from its annual product release cycle
Article Text: Apple is shifting from its annual product release cycle to more frequent and flexible launches. This new strategy aims to better manage its growing product line and complex software. By adopting staggered rollouts and multi-year refresh cycles, Apple intends to alleviate pressure on development teams and sustain innovation while maintaining revenue outside holiday quarters.
Article Summary: Apple is shifting from its annual product release cycle to more frequent and flexible launches. This new strategy aims to better manage its growing product line and complex software. By adopting staggered rollouts and multi-year refresh cycles, Apple intends to alleviate pressure on development teams.

Article Title: India EXIM has partnered with VoloFin and New India Assurance
Article Text: India Exim Finserve IFSC Pvt Ltd, a wholly owned subsidiary of Export-Import Bank of India ( India Exim Bank ), has partnered with VoloFin , to provide receivables finance solutions for Indian exporters. This partnership will support the SME exporters, who play a key role in the economic growth of the country, and it also aims to address critical trade finance gaps and enable incremental open account trade between India and its trade partners.New India Assurance is the credit insurance partner, with reinsurance support from Atradius (one of the world’s largest credit insurers) and leads the initiative with the first bank policy from GIFT City .Hirva Mamtora, MD and CEO, India Exim Finserve, said “We are leading with the mission to fuel India’s economic growth by supporting Indian exporters who play an important role in the country's growth engine. Currently, small businesses face several challenges in their growth journey. Our partnership with VoloFin, who will act as business facilitator, will help us reach out to SME exporters and importers with its existing network. We acknowledge the support received from New India Assurance in providing us with a first of its kind trade finance insurance policy from GIFT City. Availability of trade insurance policy will help us expand our factoring outreach and lead to boosting of exports from India especially from SME segment.Roshan Shah, Co-Founder and CEO, VoloFin, said, “This strategic partnership represents a vote of confidence in VoloFin’s mission to revolutionise trade finance and empower SMEs. We are committed to leveraging this relationship to bolster the capabilities of exporters in expanding their business and geographical reach and bridge the trade finance gap that hampers the growth of small businesses. This association is a significant milestone in our journey as it completely synergises with our goal, and we thank the team at India Exim Finserve & Atradius for their efforts to bring this partnership live.”
Article Summary: India Exim Finserve IFSC Pvt Ltd, a wholly owned subsidiary of Export-Import Bank of India ( India Exim Bank ), has partnered with VoloFin. This partnership will support the SME exporters, who play a key role in the economic growth of the country. It also aims to address critical trade finance gaps and enable incremental open account trade between India and its trade partners.

Article Title: Blue Origin CEO sets this 'Amazon target' for his space rocket company
Article Text: Blue Origin 's new CEO, David Limp , is aiming to bring Amazon 's customer-centric approach to Jeff Bezos ' space rocket company in an effort to catch up with competitors like SpaceX . In a recent interview with CNBC, Limp outlined his strategy to transform Blue Origin's operations and culture.Limp, who spent 15 years at Amazon, believes that prioritising customer needs is crucial for Blue Origin's success."Even if the technology is really nice and fun … the customer has to be front and centre," he told CNBC. This shift in focus aims to address the company's struggle to move beyond the research and development phase and accelerate manufacturing processes.The CEO identified two main goals for 2024: increasing engine production and successfully launching the New Glenn rocket. The latter, scheduled for a November test flight, could prove Blue Origin's ability to compete with industry leader SpaceX.Limp acknowledged that Blue Origin had excelled at building "shiny factories" and "high-fidelity prototypes" but emphasised the need to scale up to become a "world-class manufacturer."The New Glenn rocket, standing over 320 feet tall, features partly reusable components similar to SpaceX's Falcon Heavy. Limp expressed hope that the rocket, nicknamed "So You're Telling Me There's a Chance," would make history by successfully returning its reusable booster on its first attempt.While optimistic about the upcoming launch, Limp maintains a pragmatic outlook. "It'll be adventurous. It'll be fun. I'm excited about it … but if we [don't] stick the landing the first time, that's OK. We've got another booster right behind it. We'll build more," he told CNBC.By adopting Amazon's customer-focused strategies, Limp aims to propel Blue Origin from its current position and realise Bezos' vision of making space travel more accessible and affordable.
Article Summary: David Limp, Blue Origin's new CEO, wants to bring Amazon's customer-centric approach to the space rocket company. Limp identified two main goals for 2024: increasing engine production and successfully launching the New Glenn rocket. The latter, scheduled for a November test flight, could prove the company's ability to compete with industry leader SpaceX.

Article Title: How this UN report may have just confirmed why it may not be wrong to ban Telegram
Article Text:
Representative Image

Cybercrime syndicates are often of Chinese origin

A new report by the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime ( UNODC ) may increase problems for Telegram . The report claims that the encrypted messaging app has become a key tool for powerful criminal networks in Southeast Asia where large-scale illicit activities, including trade of stolen data, cybercrime tools for deepfakes and unlicensed cryptocurrency exchanges for money laundering are taking place.According to a report by news agency Reuters, hacked data including credit card details, passwords and browser history are openly traded on a vast scale on the app, the report said.“We move 3 million USDT stolen from overseas per day,” the report quoted one ad as saying in Chinese.As per the report, several cybercrime groups -- often of Chinese origin -- are operating from fortified compounds and exploiting trafficked workers. It says that these groups target victims worldwide with fraudulent schemes, generating an estimated annual revenue between $27.4 billion and $36.5 billion."For consumers, this means their data is at a higher risk of being fed into scams or other criminal activity than ever before," warned Benedikt Hofmann, UNODC's deputy representative for Southeast Asia and the Pacific.The report also underscores how criminal groups are constantly adapting and integrating new technologies into their operations. UNODC identified over 10 deepfake software providers specifically catering to criminal groups involved in cyber-enabled fraud in Southeast Asia.This isn't the first time Telegram has faced scrutiny for its role in facilitating illegal activities.Recently, in India, a hacker is reported to have exploited Telegram chatbots to leak sensitive data from a major insurance company.A legal action against Telegram and its founder, Pavel Durov, was taken in France. He was charged with allowing criminal activity on the platform, including the spread of child sexual abuse material. Similarly, South Korean police are reportedly investigating the platform's potential involvement in online sex crimes.
Article Summary: A new report by the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime ( UNODC ) may increase problems for Telegram. The report claims that the encrypted messaging app has become a key tool for powerful criminal networks in Southeast Asia. Cybercrime groups -- often of Chinese origin -- are operating from fortified compounds and exploiting trafficked workers.

Article Title: Who is responsible for rising online frauds: Tension rises between technology companies and banks in the UK
Article Text:
Banks put the blame on Facebook, Instagram and other social media platforms

Tensions are escalating in the U.K. as banks and payment companies grapple with social media firms over who should bear the cost of compensating victims of online fraud . Starting October 7, banks will be required to reimburse up to £85,000 to victims of authorized push payment (APP) fraud, a scam where criminals trick people into sending them money.This could prove costly for large financial institutions.While the mandatory reimbursement amount is lower than the initial proposal by the Payment Systems Regulator (PSR), questions remain about whether banks are shouldering an unfair burden.Revolut, a digital bank, has accused Facebook and Instagram parent Meta of failing to do enough to combat fraud and called for tech companies to contribute to compensation. This aligns with broader concerns that social media platforms are not taking sufficient measures to protect users from scams.The government is considering proposals to force tech firms to reimburse fraud victims. However, determining a regulatory framework for companies that don't play an active role in payment systems is complex.Banks and regulators have long urged social media companies to collaborate more closely to combat fraud. They seek more detailed intelligence on criminal activities and faster removal of fraudulent accounts.Social media firms argue that they are taking steps to address fraud, including through partnerships with banks and the use of advanced technology. They also emphasize the need for cross-industry collaboration.
Article Summary: Starting October 7, banks will be required to reimburse up to £85,000 to victims of authorized push payment (APP) fraud, a scam where criminals trick people into sending them money. Revolut, a digital bank, has accused Facebook and Instagram parent Meta of failing to do enough to combat fraud.

Article Title: When Apple founder Steve Jobs told a group of consultants: You will never get to "taste this" in your jobs
Article Text: In a 1992 MIT lecture, Steve Jobs criticized the consulting profession for its lack of substantive engagement and long-term accountability. He argued that consultants miss out on meaningful learning and growth because they do not own the results of their recommendations.
Article Summary: In a 1992 MIT lecture, Steve Jobs criticized the consulting profession for its lack of substantive engagement and long-term accountability. He argued that consultants miss out on meaningful learning and growth because they do not own the results of their recommendations. In a 2012 TED Talk, Jobs said that consultants should be held to a higher standard.

Article Title: Vodafone-Idea launches new Rs 175 plan with 15+ OTT subscriptions including SonyLIV, ZEE5, ManoramaMAX, FanCode and Playflix: All details
Article Text:
Vi Rs 175 super pack: Details

Vodafone Idea (Vi) has launched a new subscription plan for its users. Dubbed as Vi Super pack , the plan is priced at Rs 175 and offers access to more than 15 Over-The-Top (OTT) platforms like SonyLIV, ZEE5, ManoramaMAX, FanCode, Playflix and more on a single app along with 10GB mobile data.As announced by the telecom operator, the Vi Rs 175 subscription plan offers access to over 15 OTT platforms.The Rs 175 plan is available for prepaid users recharging with Vi Hero Unlimited Rs 449 and Rss 979 pack at no extra cost. These packs offer unlimited calling, daily data quota, along with unique data benefits like unlimited high-speed data from 12am to 6am, weekend data rollover & much more.The new subscription plan joins the existing Vi Movies & TV Plus, Vi Movies & TV Lite, Vi Movies & TV Pro plans. Vi Movies & TV Plus is a month plan that is priced at Rs 248. It offers unlimited access to 17 OTT apps, 350 live TV channels, in addition to various content libraries.The Vi Movies & TV- Lite prepaid plan will cost Rs 154 per month. It provides easy access to 16 OTT apps on a single mobile device. The plan comes with an additional 2GB of data. Vi Movies & TV Pro prepaid plan, on the other hand, offers access to more than 13 OTT apps at Rs 202 per month. The plan offers an extra 5GB of data and can be used on two devices – TV and mobile.
Article Summary: Vodafone Idea (Vi) has launched a new subscription plan for its users. Dubbed as Vi Super pack, the plan is priced at Rs 175 and offers access to more than 15 Over-The-Top (OTT) platforms on a single app along with 10GB mobile data.

Article Title: Government warns of pension scam: How fraudsters are targeting on WhatsApp as annual Jeevan Pranaam certificate date nears
Article Text:
What is the Jeevan Pramaan certificate?

How the Scam Works:

Pensioners receive messages on WhatsApp, often impersonating government officials.



The message claims their pension is at risk due to an outdated Jeevan Pramaan certificate.



The message includes a link or form requesting personal information like bank account details or PPO numbers.



Once the information is submitted, scammers can use it for identity theft or financial fraud .



How to protecting yourself from the scam:

Do not click on any suspicious links or download attachments included in such messages.



Never share personal information like bank account details or PPO numbers through WhatsApp.



For any queries regarding Jeevan Pramaan, contact your bank or the official CPAO website.



Report the Scam:

The Indian government has issued a warning to pensioners about a fraudulent scheme circulating on WhatsApp. With the annual deadline for submitting the Jeevan Pramaan certificate approaching, fraudsters are targeting vulnerable individuals through the popular messaging platform.The Jeevan Pramaan certificate is a mandatory document required by pensioners to continue receiving their pension payments.Scammers are exploiting this by sending fake messages to pensioners, claiming their pension will be stopped unless they update their Jeevan Pramaan certificate or submit personal details through a provided link."These messages are a deliberate attempt to steal personal information and potentially financial resources from unsuspecting pensioners," a spokesperson for the Central Pension Accounting Office (CPAO) stated.The government emphasises that official communication regarding Jeevan Pramaan certificates will never be done through WhatsApp or any other social media platform. Pensioners are advised to follow these steps:If you receive a suspicious message, report it to the authorities immediately. You can forward the message to the National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal (NCRP) or contact your local police station.
Article Summary: The Indian government has issued a warning to pensioners about a fraudulent scheme circulating on WhatsApp. With the annual deadline for submitting the Jeevan Pramaan certificate approaching, fraudsters are targeting vulnerable individuals through the popular messaging platform. Pensioners are advised to follow these steps: Report a suspicious message to the authorities immediately.

Article Title: Meet the entrepreneur who sold his $3.7 billion startup and made 400 employees millionaires
Article Text:
A life changing decision behind Jyoti Bansal’s sale of $3.7 billion success of AppDynamics



The emotional challenges being faced for selling off AppDynamics



Also Read |

AppDynamics founder Jyoti Bansal , had a dream which many business minds have, to launch a startup but took one of the difficult decisions of selling it for a large $3.7 billion but this pleasure of achievement turned into one of the profound regrets.He made the hardest decision of selling his software startup by thinking of his employees. He graduated from IIT Delhi and is considered the lead inventor on over 20 US patents.After selling his startup to the employees he quoted as the right move for his staff around 400 employees became millionaires after selling off.Jyoti Bansal is the founder of AppDynamics, a software startup which he sold in 2017. In his mid-forties he spent numerous years in polishing his software engineering skills until his own entrepreneurial aspirations took root. Before going public, he was approached by the renowned communications tech company Cisco and was offered to buy his company for USD 3.7 billion. Where Bansal prioritised the future fortunes of his employees thus making it one of the hardest decisions of his career too.Once Bansal gave the green signal to the proposition, many greeted the 400 AppDynamics employees as their stocks soared up to almost $1million. Bansal further stated as the game changer for the values being soared up while some were even soared up to $5million.Bansal described his experience as the sleepless nights after the sale and believed that people might think selling off the company was an easy task but it was the hardest decision of his career. After the celebration party, he realised that he didn't even want to go back home, which he described as the bittersweet moment.
Article Summary: Jyoti Bansal is the founder of AppDynamics, a software startup which he sold in 2017. Before going public, he was approached by the renowned communications tech company Cisco and was offered to buy his company for USD 3.7 billion. After the celebration party, he realised that he didn't even want to go back home.

Article Title: Airtel Business partners with Fortinet, launches ‘Airtel Secure Internet’ for businesses
Article Text:
What is Airtel Secure Internet service

Airtel Business , the B2B arm of Bharti Airtel has entered into partnership with Fortinet for the launch of ‘ Airtel Secure Internet ’, a security solution which claims to offer defence against cyber threats.The company claims that the security solution is designed specifically to enhance security over Internet Lease Line (ILL) circuits, combining Airtel’s internet connectivity with Fortinet’s next-generation firewall.It offers comprehensive, end-to-end protection through Airtel’s Security Operations Centre (SOC) and Fortinet’s Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR) platform, ensuring robust management and defence against cyber threats.The service allows for seamless upgrades or downgrades as needed, ensuring businesses always stay ahead of emerging security challenges. Airtel’s SOC utilises advanced orchestration tools with AI and ML algorithms to automate threat mitigation, providing robust, proactive defence.The fully managed service also integrates next-generation firewall (NGFW) with enterprise grade threat protection, which offers comprehensive protection through firewalls, intrusion detection, antivirus and content filtering, all from a single platform.Sharat Sinha, CEO - Airtel Business said, “Cybersecurity is becoming increasingly complex and many organisations lack the resources to manage it effectively. We have been pioneers in offering inclusive Cyber Secured ILL in the Indian market. With the launch of yet another innovative security solution — ‘Airtel Secure Internet’— we offer a comprehensive, future-proof solution that strengthens enterprises’ security without the burden of high capex.”
Article Summary: Airtel Business, the B2B arm of Bharti Airtel has entered into partnership with Fortinet for the launch of ‘Airtle Secure Internet ’ The security solution claims to offer defence against cyber threats.

Article Title: Jeff Bezos: Know about his early life, Amazon journey and current net worth as of 2024
Article Text:
Jeff Bezos early life and career



Beginning of Amazon



Jeff Bezos current net worth



Jeff Bezos lesser-known facts



Jeff aims to create a clock that will run for 10,000 years located inside a mountain in West Texas and is designed to encourage long-term thinking and reflecting on humanity’s future.

The initiative of Amazon Prime Air, an initiative which was focussed on using drones for package delivery aiming to revolutionise the logistics and reduce the delivery times.

Bezos committed to become carbon neutral by 2040 which he announced in 2019 ahead of the Paris Agreement goals.

Haven, co-founded by Jeff Bezos in view to collaborate with Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase to improve the healthcare of the employees.

In 2021, Bezos co-founded a biotechnology company Altos Labs focussing on cellular programming aiming to extend human life.

An American influential and one of the prominent personalities, best known as the founder and former CEO of Amazon has become one of the richest personalities in the world. Jeff Bezos was born on 12 January 1964 holding one of the world’s largest e-commerce platforms Amazon and cloud computing companies. His relentless pursuit of taking Amazon to greater heights and innovative thinking revolutionise the company’s performance.Jeff has also marked on several ambitious projects that reflect his vision for the future.Blue Origin, founded in 2000 is an aerospace company which aims to lower the cost of space travel and make it accessible to the general public. Apart from this, Jeff has made himself into one of the influential leaders by following some of the notable projects embarking on his vision.Jeff Bezos was born in Albuquerque, New Mexico to a family of teenage parents who got separated shortly after his birth. At the age of four, he was adopted by Miguel Bezos, an immigrant who became an important part of his life. Bezos has transformed the e-commerce landscape and ventured into space exploration with his company Blue Origin. His fascination within technology began in his early life and converted his parents garage into a laboratory.Bezos then attended River Oaks Elementary School in Houston, Texas and graduated as valedictorian from Miami Palmetto High School in 1982. He also initiated his business venture, a summer camp called the Dream Institute for younger students and demonstrating his entrepreneurial spirit. He pursued a degree in Physics but then later switched to electrical engineering and computer science. Jeff was recognised for his excellence in academics as being elected to honour for prestigious excellence including Phi Beta Kappa and Tau Beta Pi.Jeff, being an influential personality, became the youngest vice president at the age of 30 by working on Wall Street at several firms including Fitel, D.E. Shaw & Co.Following this, in 1994, Bezos recognised the potential of the internet where he left his job and started the beginning of Amazon in the same year. Amazon was initially an online bookstore which has evolved into one of the largest e-commerce platforms globally. Additionally, in 2000 he founded Blue Origin to reduce the space travel costs and enable human colonisation of space. In 2013 he also purchased The Washington Post.As of October 2024, Jeff has an estimated net worth of $204 billion. This marks his position as the fourth richest person in the world as per Forbes.
Article Summary: Jeff Bezos was born on 12 January 1964 in Albuquerque, New Mexico. His fascination within technology began in his early life and converted his parents garage into a laboratory. He pursued a degree in Physics but then later switched to electrical engineering and computer science. In 1994, Bezos recognised the potential of the internet where he left his job and started the beginning of Amazon in the same year. As of October 2024, Jeff has an estimated net worth of $204 billion.

Article Title: WazirX hacked: Government agencies probe Rs 2,000 crore crypto theft
Article Text:
IB, CERT-In probing WazirX hack

Hackers starts withdrawing stolen digital assets

WazirX is facing scrutiny from top government agencies. The cryptocurrency exchange suffered a cyber hack in July this year that resulted in a massive Rs 2,000 crore (about $234 million) loss. As millions of users anxiously await refunds of their investments, government agencies are taking action as concerns grow over the impact on WazirX investors.According to a Money Control report, officials from the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU), Intelligence Bureau (IB), and the Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) have held meetings with WazirX's top executives to investigate the reported hacking of the crypto platform. TFor those unaware, CERT-In is a nodal agency for cybersecurity that works under the aegis of the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology. It will look after the technical side of the hack, the report says. While the IB under home ministry is tasked to review the security and counterintelligence aspects. FIU under the finance ministry is looking after the financial transactions aspect.As per the report, WazirX has provided information as sought by agencies, including details on server and laptop logs, transaction trails, and the blockchain addresses linked to the hacking. The crypto exchange has previously admitted that nearly 43 per cent of its users are likely to lose their money stolen in digital assets, affecting users from India the most.Hackers, as stated in an IANS report have already started withdrawing stolen digital assets via the Tornado Cash platform. It is an open-source, fully decentralised cryptocurrency mixer platform that runs on Ethereum Virtual Machine-compatible networks.A report by The Crypto Times last week stated that WazirX removed the video of a live town hall session on YouTube that claimed to offer “100 per cent profits from any crypto price appreciation in future with users”.
Article Summary: WazirX suffered a cyber hack in July this year that resulted in a massive Rs 2,000 crore (about $234 million) loss. Officials from Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU), Intelligence Bureau (IB), and the Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) have held meetings with top executives to investigate the reported hacking.

Article Title: Google’s search ad market in US may go down below 50% after 10 years; how Amazon and TikTok may be responsible
Article Text: Google's search ad market share in the US is expected to fall below 50% by 2025 due to rising competition from TikTok, Amazon, and AI startup Perplexity. Amazon's gain in search ad spending reflects advertisers' desire for more options and lower costs.
Article Summary: Google's search ad market share in the US is expected to fall below 50% by 2025 due to rising competition from TikTok, Amazon, and AI startup Perplexity. Amazon's gain in search ad spending reflects advertisers' desire for more options and lower costs.

Article Title: How Chinese hackers may have used two of the ‘biggest telecom networks in US’ to access sensitive data
Article Text:
Who is behind the attack and which companies are impacted

What China has to say on hacking charges

Chinese hackers have reportedly infiltrated the networks of major US broadband providers , gaining access to sensitive information, including data from systems used for court-authorised wiretapping.The hackers may have access to network infrastructure used to cooperate with lawful US requests for communications data for months, says the report from a Wall Street Journal, which cited sources familiar with the matter as saying.The attackers also had access to other tranches of more generic internet traffic, they said.Verizon Communications , AT&T and Lumen Technologies are among the telecom companies affected by this breach. The hackers, believed to be part of a Chinese intelligence-gathering operation dubbed “Salt Typhoon” by US investigators, may have accessed and intercepted communications data legally obtained by the US government through court orders.The report also said that the hackers appear to have collected vast internet traffic from internet service providers. Additionally, there are indications that the hacking campaign targeted a small number of service providers outside of the US, the people were quoted as saying.“It will take time to unravel how bad this is, but in the meantime it’s the most significant in a long string of wake-up calls that show how the PRC has stepped up their cyber game. If companies and governments weren’t taking this seriously before, they absolutely need to now,” said Brandon Wales, former executive director at the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency and now a vice president at SentinelOne, referring to the People’s Republic of China.China's foreign ministry responded to the allegations, denying knowledge of the specific attack but accusing the US of fabricating a narrative to blame China.“At a time when cybersecurity has become a common challenge for all countries around the world, this erroneous approach will only hinder the efforts of the international community to jointly address the challenge through dialogue and cooperation,” the ministry said in a statement to news agency Reuters.This incident follows recent US efforts to disrupt other Chinese hacking groups, including “Flax Typhoon” and “Volt Typhoon.”
Article Summary: Hackers may have accessed and intercepted communications data legally obtained by the US government through court orders. The hackers appear to have collected vast internet traffic from internet service providers. China's foreign ministry denies knowledge of the specific attack but accuses the US of fabricating a narrative to blame China.

Article Title: Google pays $2.7 billion to bring back an old employee leading to this big debate on overspending on AI
Article Text:
Representative Image

The 'overspending on AI' debate

Why Shazeer left Google after 21 years

Back to Google -- Homecoming

The AI Talent War

What Shazeer's return to Google may signify

Noam Shazeer , a pioneer in the field of artificial intelligence, left Google in 2021 after clashing with management over the release of a powerful chatbot he co-developed. However, in a surprising turn of events, Google has brought him back with a massive deal. According to a report in WSJ, Google paid a staggering $2.7 billion to acquire Shazeer's company, Character.AI .While officially presented as a technology licensing deal, the true prize was Shazeer himself. Now a Google vice president, he will spearhead the development of the company's next-generation AI project, Gemini . This aggressive move raises questions about the escalating cost of acquiring top AI talent. While Shazeer is undoubtedly a brilliant mind, some experts wonder if the price tag reflects his true value.As the report said, "The arrangement has thrust him into the middle of a debate in Silicon Valley about whether tech giants are overspending in the race to develop cutting-edge AI, which some believe will define the future of computing."Shazeer joined Google in the year 2000 and was among the company's first few employees. He's credited with co-authoring a groundbreaking research paper that became a cornerstone for modern AI. He also championed the creation of Meena, a chatbot capable of engaging conversations, which Google ultimately shelved over safety concerns.In 2017, Shazeer teamed with a Google colleague, Daniel De Freitas, to build a chatbot originally named Meena that could banter confidently on a range of topics. In a widely circulated memo, “Meena Eats the World,” Shazeer predicted it could replace Google’s search engine and produce trillions of dollars in revenue, said people familiar with the document.Google reportedly did not release the chatbot to the public, citing concerns around safety and fairness. Shazeer and De Freitas quit in 2021 to launch Character. "Feeling Google lacked the boldness he believed was necessary for AI advancement, Shazeer left to launch Character.AI. Their vision: a chatbot that could benefit those struggling with loneliness or depression. However, the company faced an uphill battle against established giants and the high costs associated with AI development," said the report.With Character struggling financially, Google pounced on the opportunity to reacquire Shazeer's expertise. While the deal enriched him with hundreds of millions of dollars, Google's primary goal was to secure his talent.This hefty price tag reflects the intense competition for top AI talent. Google isn't alone in using "acqui-hire" deals to secure talent from struggling startups rather than go through lengthy acquisition processes. This approach allows them to quickly onboard coveted researchers whose companies lack a strong revenue stream.Shazeer's return signifies a shift in Google's approach to AI. Co-founder Sergey Brin signaled a more aggressive strategy, emphasizing a willingness to rapidly deploy AI technology. Shazeer's expertise will be crucial in Google's quest to stay ahead in the race for AI dominance. At a recent conference, Brin said that Google was previously too timid in deploying AI applications. Now, he said, Google is developing and launching AI technology as fast as it can. “Noam, by the way, is back at Google, which is awesome,” he added.
Article Summary: Noam Shazeer, a pioneer in the field of artificial intelligence, left Google in 2021 after clashing with management over the release of a powerful chatbot he co-developed. Now a Google vice president, he will spearhead the development of the company's next-generation AI project, Gemini. This aggressive move raises questions about the escalating cost of acquiring top AI talent.

Article Title: Why Reliance Jio and Airtel may be going slow on 5G network expansion
Article Text: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are cautiously expanding their 5G networks due to low capacity utilization and monetization opportunities. Both companies aim to upgrade their existing 4G users to 5G services. Jio and Airtel's suppliers, Nokia and Ericsson, expect further investments only with increased demand. Jio's current 5G network covers over 90% of India's population.
Article Summary: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are cautiously expanding their 5G networks due to low capacity utilization and monetization opportunities. Both companies aim to upgrade their existing 4G users to 5G services. Jio's current 5G network covers over 90% of India's population.

Article Title: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal to Kunal Kamra: ‘I’ll even pay more than you earned…’
Article Text: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal and comedian Kunal Kamra clashed online over the service quality of Ola's electric scooters. Kamra criticized the company's handling of service centers, while Aggarwal accused Kamra of posting paid tweets and invited him to help solve the issues. The exchange continued with heated remarks from both sides.
Article Summary: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal and comedian Kunal Kamra clashed online over the service quality of Ola's electric scooters. Kamra criticized the company's handling of service centers, while Aggarwalk accused Kamra of posting paid tweets.

Article Title: Foreign minister has an ‘AI warning’: “AI will be as dangerous….”
Article Text:
External affairs minister S Jaishankar at Kautilya economic conclave

India banking on human-centric AI development

External Affairs Minister Dr S. Jaishankar on Sunday (October 6) said that artificial intelligence ( AI ) will be a profound factor for the world, after nuclear weapons . He was speaking at the third edition of the Kautilya Economic Conclave .“AI will be as dangerous for the world as nuclear bombs once were,” he said on its third and final day of the conclave organised by the Institute of Economic Growth and the Finance Ministry .He added that AI is going to be the next big thing and countries should be prepared to deal with its after-effects.Explaining the impact of globalisation , Jaishankar said that it is also going to become a profound factor in the global ecosystem and that demographics and connectivity will change the global order.“Globalisation can be weaponised in the next decade and the world must be cautious about it,” he said.“Many people around the world blame it for the large number of job losses and other negative effects of the revolution. This issue will remain as long as there is change (globalisation)," he said, noting that the social and political reaction to globalisation has gained momentum in the last decade.Earlier this year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that India is striving for a better future through human-centric artificial intelligence (AI) development. He said India is among the first few countries to formulate a national strategy for Al.“During the G20 Summit hosted in India last year, we emphasised the importance of international governance in the field of AI,” the Prime Minister said, addressing the world leaders at the G7 Outreach Session.“In the future too, we will continue to work together with all countries to make Al transparent, fair, secure, accessible and responsible," the PM added.Based on this strategy, the country launched the Al Mission this year.
Article Summary: Jaishankar was speaking at the third edition of the Kautilya Economic Conclave. He added that AI is going to be the next big thing and countries should be prepared to deal with its after-effects. “Globalisation can be weaponised in the next decade and the world must be cautious about it,” he said.

Article Title: Government has a “cybersecurity tip of the day” for citizens
Article Text:
Carefully check the URL before clicking on it.

Never react to messages which show urgency.

Do not trust promotional offers which look "too good to be true".

Do not hesitate to report to Law Enforcement Agencies, if you become a victim of phishing.

Verify the email ids in emails addressed to generic recipients.

Look for typing errors (eg., AccOunt, emall, depOsit, passwOrd)

"Do yu kare about yurself?" Look for poor grammar and unprofessional Language.

Cert-In also observing October as 'National Cyber Security Awareness Month'

Never use your name, age, birthday, phone number, address, place, or any other sensitive personal information as your password.

Use a unique password for each account.

Don't share your password with anyone.

Enable Multi-Factor Authentication.

Always log out from the devices when you have finished your task.

Do not store your passwords in your phone or laptop.

Use strong passwords .

. Avoid keeping the same passwords for multiple accounts.

Government has tips for citizens to stay safe online. Information Security Education and Awareness ( ISEA ) under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has posted seven “best practices” that citizens can follow.“Verify the website before clicking & while sharing sensitive content,” said ISEA, a project that is aimed “towards human resources development for safe, trusted, and secure cyberspace”.Phishing scams are a type of cyberattack where fraudsters impersonate trustworthy entities to trick individuals into revealing sensitive information like passwords, credit card numbers, or personal data.As a part of observing October 2024 as ‘ National Cyber Security Awareness Month ’, the government listed 7 points:CERT-In also announced that it is observing October 2024 as 'National Cyber Security Awareness Month' for “Cyber Surakshit Bharat”. It separately listed things to keep in mind while surfing online and choosing passwords for multiple accounts.
Article Summary: Government has tips for citizens to stay safe online. Information Security Education and Awareness ( ISEA ) under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has posted seven “best practices” that citizens can follow. CERT-In also announced that it is observing October 2024 as 'National Cyber Security Awareness Month' for “Cyber Surakshit Bharat’
